Government Shutdown Notice

Due to the Federal Government shutdown, NOAA.gov and most associated web sites are unavailable. However, because the information this site provides is necessary to protect life and property, it will be updated and maintained during the Federal Government shutdown.

  • Today Mostly sunny, with a high near 43. West wind 8 to 11 mph.
  • Tonight Partly cloudy, with a low around 25. West wind 5 to 10 mph becoming light and variable.
  • Saturday Isolated showers after noon. Mostly sunny, with a high near 47. Southeast wind 6 to 11 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.
  • Saturday Night A slight chance of rain and snow showers before midnight, then scattered snow showers. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 29. Southeast wind 6 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.
  • Sunday A chance of snow before noon, then a chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 47. Light and variable wind becoming east around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New snow accumulation of around an inch possible.
  • Sunday Night A chance of rain and snow before midnight, then a chance of snow. Cloudy, with a low around 31. Calm wind. Chance of precipitation is 50%.
  • Columbus Day A 40 percent chance of snow. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 41. Light northwest wind.
  • Monday Night A 20 percent chance of snow. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 26.
  • Tuesday A 20 percent chance of snow. Mostly sunny, with a high near 43.
  • Tuesday Night Partly cloudy, with a low around 25.
  • Wednesday Mostly sunny, with a high near 44.
  • Wednesday Night Partly cloudy, with a low around 28.
  • Thursday Mostly sunny, with a high near 45.
